conclusion: There are two fixed rods, OA and OB, in a vertical plane. Rod OA is vertical, and rod OB is at a 45-degree angle to OA. There are light rings E and F that can move freely on these rods. A mass m is suspended by a non-extensible light rope connected to these rings at point D.
The system is in equilibrium because the object is at rest. That means all the forces and torques are balanced.
The weight of the mass is mg acting downward.
The tension in the rope connected to point D.
Since the rope is massless and inextensible, the tension should be the same throughout the rope.
Ring E is on rod OA, which is vertical.
Ring F is on rod OB, which is at 45 degrees to OA.
The normal force from the rod OA is F1.
The normal force from the rod OB is F2.
Since the rings are in equilibrium, the forces acting on them must balance.
Rod OB is at 45 degrees from the vertical.
The normal force from the rod OA acts horizontally.
The normal force from the rod OB acts at 135 degrees from the vertical.

premise: The tension force is T, acting along the direction of the rope. The normal force F1 is horizontal.
conclusion: The force between ring E and rod OA is mg.

premise: The tension force is T, acting along the direction of the rope. The normal force F2 is at 135 degrees from the vertical.
conclusion: The force between ring F and rod OB is âˆš2mg.
